title: SUGGESTION FOR TRIBUNAL
body:
This is my suggestion for a new tribunal system.

Basically it would be like overwatch like they have in CS:GO etc. What I am suggesting is that if a player were to report another player for X reason. Then players from that game (on both sides) should be given the option to A. review the match for evidence and B. to vote on a punishment if they are also in agreement.

In addition I think accounts should have a strike system. If a player has been reported for a particular reason they earn a strike. If they get reported again in a game afterwards they earn another strike. At 3 strikes they get a temporary ban. For continual offences the punishment gets harsher. 

Thoughts?

replies.body:
The overwatch idea isn't bad, but it would need to be moderated heavily. If there's a 4-man that all hate the other guy on the team, then it's a potentially unfair punishment.

The strikes are an excellent idea though, it's a good way to slow unfair punishment. *But* they'd need to be for lesser punishments - if someone is yelling racist abuse and feeding for a whole game, I'd ban them on the spot, but if someone is harassing I'd give them a strike as a warning and then ban/mute them if they continue in other games.
I disagree if there is a feeder on my team who sed top or feed or mid or feed and they feed im gona flame them like crazy don't ban me for flaming the troll

Yeah stuff like this will always need to find the sweet spot. That's why we need a tribunal, then we know stuff is actually being done about all the toxics we see. What people see as feeding may just be a one off bad game though, 2/10/5 is a crappy game but 0/20 is trolling. If we use the strikes the people who actually feed get caught, but people with a dodgy game get a second chance.
